intro: Monnina rugosa, commonly known as rough monnina, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, rugose (wrinkled) leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. It is an annual or biennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Monnina rugosa is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various purposes.
